com.eemi.ext4j.client.chart.series

Class AbstractSerie

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eemi.ext4j.client.core.JsObject
      • com.eemi.ext4j.client.chart.series.AbstractSerie
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CartesianSerie, PieSerie, RadarSerie

    public abstract class AbstractSerie
extends JsObject
    AbstractSerie is the abstract class containing the common logic to all chart series. AbstractSerie includes methods from Labels, Highlights, Tips and Callouts mixins. This class implements the logic of handling mouse events, animating, hiding, showing all elements and returning the color of the series to be used as a legend item.
    Author:
    alainekambi

      • setHighLighter

        public void setHighLighter(HighLighter value)
        If set to true it will highlight the markers or the series when hovering with the mouse. This parameter can also be an object with the same style properties you would apply to a Ext.draw.Sprite to apply custom styles to markers and series.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setAxis

        public void setAxis(java.lang.String value)
        The position of the axis to bind the values to. Possible values are 'left', 'bottom', 'top' and 'right'. You must explicitly set this value to bind the values of the line series to the ones in the axis, otherwise a relative scale will be used. For example, if you're using a Scatter or Line series and you'd like to have the values in the chart relative to the bottom and left axes then axis should be ['left', 'bottom']. Defaults to: "left"
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setAxis

        public void setAxis(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString value)
        The position of the axis to bind the values to. Possible values are 'left', 'bottom', 'top' and 'right'. You must explicitly set this value to bind the values of the line series to the ones in the axis, otherwise a relative scale will be used. For example, if you're using a Scatter or Line series and you'd like to have the values in the chart relative to the bottom and left axes then axis should be ['left', 'bottom']. Defaults to: "left"
        Parameters:
        value -
